keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Violent opposition from small groups of rebels reflects broader anger brewing against President Daniel Ortega as he has consolidated his power.

headline.print_headline: The Contras Are Back, but Nicaragua Denies It
headline.main: Ortega vs. the Contras: Nicaragua Endures an ’80s Revival

snippet: Violent opposition from small groups of rebels reflects broader anger brewing against President Daniel Ortega as he has consolidated his power.
abstract: Nicaraguan government of Pres Daniel Ortega denies existence of rebel contras, who vow to overturn leadership they say is self-serving and corrupt, despite reports of skirmishes in rural areas around the country; unlike contras of 1980s, when Ortega was first in power, group does not have outside funding for their cause.
